lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq crm diRsit idib diRsit huie durmiq locn ACq AMD kMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Charam Drisati Dibi Drisati Hui , Duramati Lochan Achhat Andh Kandh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Accepting the initiation sermon of the True Guru turns the outward vision of a person into divine vision. But the base wisdom makes a person blind despite the presence of eyes. Such a person is bereft of knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq suriq kY bjr kpwt Kuly durmiq kiTn kpwt snbMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Surati Kai Bajar Kapaat Khulay , Duramati Katthin Kapaat Sanabandh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: With the sermon of the True Guru, the tight shut doors of the consciousness become ajar whereas this does not happen in the case of a person of base wisdom and self will.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq pRym rs AMmiRq inDwn pwn durmiq muiK durbcn durgMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Praym Ras Anmrit Nidhaan Paana , Duramati Moukhi Durabachan Duragandh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By adopting the counsel of the True Guru, one relishes the elixir of God's love perpetually. But base wisdom emanates foul smell from the mouth as a result of ill and bad words spoken.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq shj suBwie n hrK sog durmiq ibgH ibroD kRoD sMiD hY ]176]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sahaj Soubhaai N Harakh Soga , Duramati Bigrah Birodh Krodh Sandhi Hai ?176?

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting the wisdom of True Guru produces true love and peace. He is never touched by happiness or sorrow in this state. However, base wisdom remains a cause of discord, quarrels and distress. (176)
